page.title: 05HISTORIC HOUSES,BROADSTAIRS
page.content: In Broadstairs you will find some interesting historic buildings.Just up from the beach you will find{Dickens {House}museum.Miss Strong who used to live here stopped donkeys going in front of her cottage.Dickens used her as Betsy Trotwood in David Copperfield .On the cliff top is{Fort House}where Dickens stayed and in 1851 started his novel Bleak House.Today the basement is a smuggling museum.As the{Clock {Tower}on the sea-front was burnt down by vandals the residents built a new one in 1977.Did you know that Princess Victoria when she was 10 spent part of her summer holiday with her mother in{ {Pierremont Hall}which is now a council office?Nearby is{Crampton Tower}named after Thomas Crampton who built the town's water and gas works and laid the first undersea telegraph cable between England and France.
